original: Friman, Carl Algot, konsul, Göteborg, f. 31/8/81 i Överums Bruk, Kalmar 1., av kamr. P. E. F. o. Ailma Müntzing. Barn: Sven f. 08, dir., Margit 13, korresp., g. Erlandson, Folke 19, gymn:dir. — Elev v. Gbgs hand :inst. 97-99, landstjbef :ex. i Falun 15, land-st :kapt:ex. å Gottskär 29. Insp :res. t. Engl., Frankr., Ital., Österr. o. Tyskl. m. fl länder 12-15, aff :res. t. flera europ. länder. Kont. t. 04, kont:-chef i firma A. Karlson Metall- o. Maskin A-B i Sthlm 04, styr :led. där 08, verkst. dir. 11, intend. (försäljn:-chef) h. Stora Kopparb. Bergsl. i Falun o. Söderfors Bruks Falu-kont. 12, övertog grosshand:- o. ag:firma Ivar Müntzing & Co. i Gbg 15, ombild. föret, t, A-B 22, verkst. dir, där, Finl. konsul f, v, Sv:e 19-26, V. ordf. i brandstyr., v. brandchef o. v. ordf. i fattigv :s tyr. i Stocksund 09-11, chef f. Falu landst:komp. 14-15, grund. IFK centr :styr, o, ledare av fören. första s’kolungd:tävl, i StMm, kassör i E. Bergvalls Idr:tidn. 04, ordf. i Sv. hand:ag. fören. avd. f. Gbg o. v. Sv:e 41-43. Sv. rekord i löpn. 150 m., nord. mäst. på 100 m. i Gävle Oil, sv. mäst. på 100 m. i Gbg 01, bäste fältskytt i Kopparb. 1. 15. Hobbies: odling o. friluftsliv. FinlVROlkl, FinlFrK3kl, 2 FMM 18, Gbgs landst:bef :fören. för-tj:GM, Idr:-, Skytte- o. Landst:m. i guld, Landst.-ryttarkompet :m.
translated: Friman, Carl Algot, consul, Gothenburg, born August 31, 1881 in Överums Bruk, Kalmar County, son of P.E.F. and Ailma Müntzing. Children: Sven, born 1908, director; Margit, born 1913, correspondent, married to Erlandson; Folke, born 1919, gymnasium director. He was a student at Gothenburg commercial institute from 1897-1899, passed the county treasurer exam in Falun in 1915, passed the county captain exam at Gottskär in 1929. He went on inspections trips to England, France, Italy, Austria, Germany, and other countries from 1912 to 1915 and went on business trips to several European countries. He started working for A. Karlson Metall- and Maskin AB in Stockholm as an accountant in 1904, became a board member in 1908, was appointed executive director in 1911, became sales manager for Stora Kopparberg Bergslagen in Falun and Söderfors Bruk Falun office in 1912, took over the wholesale and agency Ivar Müntzing & Co. in Gothenburg in 1915, restructured the company as a corporation in 1922, became executive director and Finnish consul for Sweden from 1919-1926, was deputy chairman of the fire department, deputy fire chief, and deputy chairman of the poor relief authority in Stocksund from 1909-1911, was the commander of Falu County Company from 1914-1915, founded the IFK central board, led the association for the first school youth competition in Stockholm, was treasurer of E. Bergvall's sports newspaper in 1904, was chairman of the Swedish commercial association department for Gothenburg and West Sweden from 1941-1943. He held the Swedish record in the 150 m run, was the Nordic champion in the 100 m in Gävle Oil, and Swedish champion in the 100 m in Gothenburg in 1901, and was the best field shooter in Kopparberg 1 in 1915. His hobbies were gardening and outdoor activities. He received the Finnish Order of the Cross of Liberty, 3rd class, the Finnish Order of the Lion, 3rd class, and two medals of Merit in gold from the Gothenburg county treasurer association, as well as medals in sports and equestrian competitions. He married but no information about his wife is given in the abbreviated biography.
